goal.en: This course introduces to students the approaches to literature with a focus on the inter-influence among fiction, drama and mediated works. We will make close reading of some theatre scripts, exploring the intercultural adaptation and historical re-imagination on the post-cold war Euro-American stage and screen."
goal.ch: "本課程著重於跨文本分析，著重小說，戲劇，電影之間的交互影響。本學期主要閱讀6部冷戰後歐美戲劇以及他們的電影改編或延續創作。主要作品請詳細英文課程分析。This course introduces to students the approaches to literature with a focus on the inter-influence among fiction, drama, and mediated works. We will make a close reading of some theatre scripts, exploring the intercultural adaptation and historical re-imagination on the post-cold war Euro-American stage and screen. Works charged include Angels in America by Tony Kushner (1991-2, USA), Copenhagen by Michael Frayn (1998, UK), Chimerica by Lucy Kirkwood (2013, UK), Berlin 100% by (2008, German, English subtitle), Attempt on Her Life by Martin Crimp (1997, UK), and The Lehman Trilogy by Stefano Massini (2015, Italy; trans. by Richard Dixon 2020). The class involves three major activities: lectures, two group reports and/or presentations, as well as two writing essays (critical essay and/or field trip report). All students are required to finish assigned readings and films before each class, to present two group reports or presentations on selected subjects, to attend one of the designated theatrical productions, and to submit two essays of three pages on designated days."
